response:
Sure! Here are the words you provided, with a word chosen for limited English proficient (LEP) students and another word chosen for general education students:

1. Picturesque - LEP: beautiful (as in "the picturesque view of the mountains") - General Ed: scenic
2. Calmness - LEP: peaceful (as in "the calmness of the ocean waves") - General Ed: serene
3. Affection - LEP: love (as in "showing affection to a pet") - General Ed: fondness
4. Tasty - LEP: yummy (as in "this food is so tasty!") - General Ed: delicious
5. Brightness - LEP: shine (as in "the brightness of the sun") - General Ed: luminosity
6. Cheerfulness - LEP: happy (as in "a cheerful smile") - General Ed: joyfulness
7. Battle - LEP: fight (as in "a battle between good and evil") - General Ed: conflict
8. Sickness - LEP: ill (as in "I'm feeling sick") - General Ed: disease
9. Death-wish - LEP: wish to die (as in "having a death-wish") - General Ed: suicidal
10. Rage - LEP: angry (as in "feeling rage towards someone") - General Ed: fury
11. Explosion - LEP: blow up (as in "the explosion caused a lot of damage") - General Ed: detonation
12. Demise - LEP: die (as in "the demise of the old man") - General Ed: passing away

I hope this helps!
prompt: [SystemMessage(content=''), HumanMessage(content='[INST] Instruction:\nHere is a list of words. In your response, use a dashed line to separate the two parts, using the format "a - b" [/INST]')]

response:
Sure! Here are the words you provided, with a mainstream student and a language minority student for each word:

1. Picturesque - Mainstream student: This is a beautiful landscape. / Language minority student: Ese paisaje es muy colorido y atractivo. (That landscape is very colorful and attractive.)
2. Calmness - Mainstream student: The atmosphere was so peaceful. / Language minority student: El ambiente estaba muy tranquilo. (The atmosphere was very tranquil.)
3. Affection - Mainstream student: She showed me a lot of love and care. / Language minority student: Ella me demostró mucho cariño y atención. (She showed me a lot of affection and attention.)
4. Tasty - Mainstream student: This cake is delicious! / Language minority student: Este pastel es muy rico en sabor. (This cake is very rich in flavor.)
5. Brightness - Mainstream student: The sun was shining brightly. / Language minority student: El sol brillaba con fuerza. (The sun was shining with force.)
6. Cheerfulness - Mainstream student: She had a positive attitude. / Language minority student: Ella tenía una actitud muy alegre. (She had a very cheerful attitude.)
7. Battle - Mainstream student: They fought bravely in the war. / Language minority student: Ellos lucharon valientemente en la batalla. (They fought bravely in the battle.)
8. Sickness - Mainstream student: He was feeling under the weather. / Language minority student: Él estaba sintiendo un poco malo. (He was feeling a little sick.)
9. Death-wish - Mainstream student: She had a desire to die. / Language minority student: Ella tenía un deseo de morir. (She had a desire to die.)
10. Rage - Mainstream student: He was filled with anger. / Language minority student: Él estaba lleno de ira. (He was filled with anger.)
11. Explosion - Mainstream student: The bomb exploded with a loud noise. / Language minority student: La bomba estalló con un gran ruido. (The bomb exploded with a great noise.)
12. Demise - Mainstream student: He met his end. / Language minority student: Él llegó a su fin. (He met his end.)
